_header: Saint Edmund the Confessor that lieth at Pountney
Subjects: Edmund, saint, life of; saints’ lives
Bibliographic Ghosts: Southwell, Southwell Cathedral Library 7, f. 194v: prose.
_description: Life of St. Edmund, Archbishop of Canterbury, in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn edmond þe confessour þet liþ at pounteneieOf
                    godemen & trewe com þei hi were noȝt wel heie…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…Nou uor is loue we biddeþ god þat ous dere
                    aboȝteBringe ous to þe heie blisse þat is soule to
                    broȝte

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint edemond þe comfessour lyþ at pounteneyeof gode men
                    & treue I come þey he were nouȝt wel hye…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…ffor his loue we bidde god þat vs dere bouȝtebringe
                    vs to þe hyYe blis þat he his soule brouȝte

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
SEint Eadmund þe confessour þat lythy at pounteneyeOf
                    guode men and trewe he cam þes huy neren nouȝht ful
                    heiȝe…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…Nou god for þe loue of him and þat us deore
                    bouȝhteTo þulke blisse us bringue þat he is soule
                    brouȝhte
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 431-9.

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Þe haly Bishope saynte Edmonde þat liggeȝ at
                    pontenayOf gude men & trewe he come þat godde & treuthe lufed
                    ayIn Inglande was he borne in þe tovne of AbyngdoneGlad myght
                    þat modre be þat broght forthe slike a sonne…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…Now godd for his loue we pray þe als þou ful dere vs
                    boghtTo þat blis þat he is in þou graunte þat we be
                    broght

CamFitzMc128.First Lines:
SAint Edmond the confessour that lys at pounteneyOf gode men and
                    trew he come thoȝ thai ner not well hey…
CamFitzMc128.Last Lines:
…The grislokest weder that might be come from the westSwart
                    and derk and grislich and ouerkest all the toun…
CamFitzMc128.Note:
Ends imperfectly due to loss of folio(s); catchword in lower margin of
                    f. 7v is ‘and blewe so grislich’.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Edmund þe confessour þat liþ at PounteneyeOf
                    goede man and truwe com þei hi nere nouȝt wel heye…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Now ffor his loue bidde we god þat vs deore
                    bouȝteBringe vs to þulke ioye þat aungeles his soule to
                    brouȝte

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint edmunde þe confessour þat lyþ at pounteneyeof
                    goud men & trewe he cam þey hii nere noȝt wel
                    heye…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…ffor his loue bydde we god þat ous dere boȝtTo
                    brynge ous to þulke blysse þat his saule to broȝt

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEint edmund þe confessor þat liþ at pounteneyeof godemen & treu he com þei hi nere noȝt wel heie…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …nou for his loue we biddeþ god þat ous þere aboȝtebring ous to þe heie blisse þat he his soule broȝte
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum lxxx” added to right margin by later hand (f. 178).

Digital Facsimile of British Library  Cotton Julius MS D IX.

BLEge2810.First Lines: SEint Edmunde þe confessoure þat liþ at pounteneieOf godemen & trewe he com þei hij nere noȝt heie…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …Mani is þe vair miracle þat god vor him haþ ydoNou god ous bringe to þulke ioye þat is soule wende to

BLEge2891.First Lines: SEint Edmond þe confessor þat liþ at pountenieOf godeman and triwe icome þei hi nere noȝt we heiȝe…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …In þe on þer was luþer Inou þei heo ne lure þat oþer alsoþe deueles lawe of helle it is and þoru god neuere ido…
BLEge2891.Note: Lines 1-494 only: ends imperfectly due to loss of folio or folios between 181 and 182.

BLHar2277.First Lines: SEint Edmund þe confessour þat liþ at PonteneyeOf gode men & true he cam þeȝ hi nere noȝt wel heye…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …Nou for his loue we biddeþ god þat ous deore bouȝteBringe ous to þe heȝ blis þat he his soule to brouȝte
BLHar2277.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 2277.

Transactions of the London Philological Society

             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS

BLSto949.First Lines: Seynt Edmond  þe confessour þat liþ at PounteneyeOf gode men & trewe he com þei hii nere nout heye…
BLSto949.Last Lines: …Nou for is loue we biddeþ god þat us dere abouhteBrynge vs to þe heye blisse þat he is soule brouhte

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Edmund þe confessour þat lys at PounteneyOf gode
                    men & trewe he come þogh þai nere not wel hye…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Now god of þe love of him þat vs dere
                    boȝtBringe vs to þe hegh blisse þat he his soule to
                    broȝt. Amen
Lam223.Attributed Title: Saynt Edmond of Pountenay (RT); Saynt Edmund (RT)

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seynt Edmonde þe Confessour þat lith at PountneyOf good
                    men and trewe he come þof þei ner but hey…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…For his loue prei we god þat vs dere haþ
                    bouȝtBryng vs to þat hye blisse þat he was in ybrouȝt.
                    Amen.
